title: Let Karma bind herself to an ally with mantra'd W
body:
Think about it. Wouldn't it be nice if Karma could use mantra'd w on an ally? The effect would be the one of Martyr's Gambit: For the next 4 (?) sec Karma redirects a % of the incoming damage done to her tethered partner to herself. 

Thematically Karma is ,,the Enlightened One'', a person with strong mental powers and the will to protect her people. I think there wont be problems from that side.

With the right percentage it could be healthy, because karma is squishy. There would be problems with a tankkarmabuild, but one can always reduce bases and increase apscaling. I think this change could make her more unique, would give her a niche lulu and especially janna who -in my opinion- crowds out other shielding supports cant fulfill.


Thanks for taking the time

replies.body: This is actually really interesting. What if it were the other way around with enemies and Mantra'd W? A percentage of the damage Karma takes is redirected to the Mantra'd enemy ^^
This is fantastic! There would be the issue with tankier builds again but if the % scaled with ap like ekkos ult... fantastic idea!

>  I think this change could make her more unique, would give her a niche lulu and especially janna who -in my opinion- crowds out other shielding supports cant fulfill.

What do you see this niche as being that makes it so different from Janna, or especially Lulu? I'm definitely not saying the idea behind the spell isn't interesting, but it would probably need to be strongly differentiated from other targeted defensive spells to really make it niche. Does this make Karma the best single target  life saver support?

I personally think we shouldn't focus on support karma as primary karma, and focus on making mid karma feel good first, then let support karma feel good after that.

\*is still bitter over old karma being pigeon holed as a supp\*

What do you want mid Karma to do? She already has poke and burst as well as cc and damage negation. She's extremely good in a solo lane if you play her correctly.

I have played few games as Karma top and have won them all due to her versatile kit.

I really hope you aren't gonna say "more damage to her targeted abilities".

nah, more dmgz is only a bandaid fix for the short term.

She currently just doesn't feel as satsifying to play as old karma imo. On old karma her shield was an actual **shield** that could save an ally's life (around 700+ hp with 500 ap) and if mantra'd would comletely change the landscape of a team fight. Her Old Q and New Q are both good spells if viewed alone (in fact, many could say new Q is better), but in context of their current kit's, I'd say old Q had more synergy than her new Q does. New Q just doesn't really do much for controlling the flow of battle like the old one did, and it's tiny aoe coupled with the fact that the rest of her kit wants to hard engage (with that snare and speed boost shield) her new Q actually fights against her kit to some extent by wanted to be as far away from the fight in order to wear the opponent down instead.

So, in the end, I feel that several aspects in her kit are: 1) fighting against each other, and 2) limiting themselves due to providing too much utility (shield suffers in raw shield due to the really powerful haste it has, my favorite aspect of old karma[shield bomb] was removed due to aoe shield+haste being too strong)

Nostalgia is not a reason to change a champion back to what they were. There usually is a good reason for the changes in the first place.

And with 500 ap currently she can dish out a 810 damage absorbing shield at level 16. Not to mention those little shields of 405 she potentially gives to all her allies. 
Only thing that made the shield more powerful before her rework was her old passive which Riot themselves said was not well designed.

You're talking about mantra E, I'm talking about her normal E. presently, even with 500 ap, karma's normal E only gives 460 hp. It's okay, but honestly, come late game, it's just a drop in the bucket with all the damage being thrown out. More often than not, I'm using my shield more for the haste it gives rather than the raw shielding  power it provides. While this isn't necessarily a bad thing, but I'd like to see a champ's shield actually be about it's raw shielding value instead of what paltry bonus it provides. (look at every other shield a supportive champ can give their allies. Not one of them is defined by it's raw hp value, but rather what special effects it gives. Janna gives ad, morg gives cc imunity, lulu gives pix, karma gives haste) Honestly before both karma's rework and janna's nerfs, janna had a very comparable shield to karma's as far as raw damage is concerned, but janna rarely ever built and solid ap as a support because she had so much utility, she benefited more from building more utility and facilitating her team that way. (just so you know, janna's raw hp got nerfed so that riot could buff the amount of ad the shield provided, it wasn't because raw hp shields were bad)

And yes, nostalgia is not the best of reasons to revert changes, but that doesn't mean we can't learn from what was to improve what is now. And that's what I'm trying to point out. Yes old karma had her problems. But they weren't so bad that it merited such a drastic change.

(also, as a side note: no, I don't want karma to have her old passive back. Even I'm aware of the problems it caused for her, and how it made her difficult to balance properly)

Her kit is rather weak. Honestly I think she relies too much on q. What is q? wave clear, poke, main damage, main and safe way to refund mantra, most damaging, zoning, burst damage. Then we have a rather weak shield on it's own that can be useful and saves lives from time to time. w that has it's moments (are they close, do they have low health) but is so overlooked which makes sense; why would you want to go all in for a delay snare with meh damage. It was very good that they buff the ap scaling which is what the non empowered spell needed but they could've kept the some sort of multiplier on her w but it doesn't help with the poor utility it has. When she builds on ap the only thing scary about her is her mantra q, not her shields, and definitively not her w. which brings up another point why are we jamming her q with so much power. Nid gets fried for having her spears doing one shots (still gets fried for having javelin toss) and her rework did a good job of making her other skill other than pounce and heal important/relevant other than keep it"cougar is tankier and faster transform to get away". I get that soul flare is less of a problem because it doesn't scale off of distance, has mantra limitations, and opponents can simply walk out of the explosion (which is like 1/4 of the mantra damage) but really the direction Riot is taking her she is an overstuff q. Riot should revisit her kit once more to smooth her out her power rather than what they have been doing for her which was let raise up her numbers once more.

First of all: 

Thank you

Thanks for replying in such a frequent manner. I lurked around the boards and i thought it was disturbing how few red responses showed up. That changed and i and i think almost everyone who uses this forum is gratefull for the change. Especially you... they call you ,,the saint'' already ^^.
Well less fawning and more usefull conversation i guess:


Now that you mention it, you are right. It would be just another point-and-click-protection. The problem that this skill causes is the intersection with mantra'd e, especially after the latest buff (? i think it was one?). The damagetransfer would have to be so strong that it's worth more than the aoe-shield that doesnt have a healthcost. Of course there could be synergy too: singletarget-bullwark with w AND e.

To hold it back from being op, there could be a set limit of damage until the tether breaks. If that happens, there could happen two things, according to the state of the ability:

1. It's op:
When the limit of damageabsorbtion gets trespassed, the tether breaks and karma gets X% damage of the already absorbed damage as bonusdamage ( think of a zedult ). This would ensure that hitting the primetarget wouldn't result in absolute frustration for the enemyteam. In reality they would do more damage, just not on that vayne that uses the extraseconds pretty well.

2. It's underpowered for an ult:
When the limit of damageabsorbtion gets trespassed, the tether breaks and karma and her ally give of an empathic shockwave around them (wild guess: 200-350 aoe), dealing X damage (think of a maokaiult). This would ,,reward'' the karmaduo for taking the damage and staying close to an enemy. It is also reminiscent of the shieldexplosion a rather unique skill (i am a little sad- from explosive shield to MORE shield in one patch).


There are other levers that could make this ability unique. For example: Multiplicate the damage karma receives (1.2x?), Give the ally armor and magicresist, duration and range of the tether, let Karma press w again to break the connection, or let enemys BREAK the connection when they walk/dash through the tether (nice idea from CakeTheIvany below) . And i bet you guys could come up with better ideas.

Well, i hope i could show that this ability could be balanced so karma wouldnt be the best livesaver by far. She'd actively put herself in danger to protect others.

This ability mustnt ever exist on an item. Imagine what maokai or alistar would do with it.

The passive + mantra e interaction is so confusing. Do i want to shield my team or do i want to use my ult twice per fight? Not an easy decision.

Does this make Karma the best single target  life saver support?

Her name used to be Karma for a reason. While in her current state she is decent, her entire identity (even the fans!) has been foregone.

I know her Q and E are in a good place right now, but her W is a very simple spell. It could use some kind of overhaul to at least give some karma back in her name.

W Enemy: Enemy cast remains the same
W Ally: (New) Transfers X% of damage taken from target to Karma.

Mantra W Enemy: Reduce duration of root slightly. % of damage done by target is dealt at the end of the duration of the tether.
Mantra W Friendly: (New) Transfers X% of damage taken from target to Karma. At the end of the duration of the tether or when it is broken, all damage transferred is returned twofold to attackers.

This matches the ideal of Karma -- give, take -- that each of her abilities used to have and which she has now lost entirely.

edit: To answer the question in your post.

When Janna and Lulu shield you, they enable you to win trades in more reasons than just because you have the shield. Pix and the AD boost mean you are more confident that you will come out on top of a trade, while a speed boost only helps you to actually engage. Because of this, Karma support is left with the choice of maxing her Q and dealing good poke or maxing her E and being a lackluster version of Lulu.

double edit:

Thought of something really cool!

Martyrdom! Soraka kind of already does this, but she cannot actually kill herself. What would be really cool is if Karma *could*, and if she died as a result of the transfer damage her ally gained an invulnerability shield. Karma gave her life to protect her ally, and in making the sacrifice she was able to do great good. That fits the religious idea of Karma perfectly. Please.

Would be an interesting passive, this martyrdomthing. Shift her current passive to her ult and replace it with a grindpassive. I think death isnt necessary, maybe something like ,, karma gets 1 martyrdomstack per x damage shielded (with e) and damage transferred (with w)''. (Same mechanic as the BMB-support-item)

Like that she could store the pain. Would be a cool feedpassive if karma got gold equal to the number of stacks she had (reverse dravenpassive). Or she gets permanent AP and MS, similar to threshs passive.

So much potential!

Original Karma always had very binary spells, where each of her spells applied a positive effect to allies and the opposite against enemies, more or less, hence her being "karma" either good or bad. However, I personally believe this felt very uninspired, the spells were forced to not really do anything spectacular in order to fit with the theme of being polar opposite effects.

I believe a really great niche for Karma would be unique effects both positive and negative to all of her spells. However, having the same effects on the same spell should be avoided if possible, the only thing similar should be the distribution. Like the idea of her W healing allies or distributing part of their damage to karma has nothing to do with how it slows and snares enemies, this makes it more interesting and shows off how similar visuals can producing varying results.

Really, karma should get the shieldbomb back, or atleast have the focus on an aoe-shield rather than a big singletarget shield. If i want to make a single target really tanky, i take Lulu.

And it's true currently lulu and Janna outshine everyone else who has shields or disengage.

Mechanics like this has often been asked for New Karma to give her more duality again. As I first played Old Karma I thought the tether, when bound to an ally, would Heal both over time (and maybe share Damage among them).
I would like that possibility with her W.

Karma is okayish at the moment but i miss something special about her. I am sure there are flying tons of suggestions around the internet, i think riotemployees will pick one of them in the future and make good use of it.

Q/MQ remains the same
E/ME remain the same

W/MW can now be used on an ally champion

W used on ally causes the next attack or spell used on the target to instead effect karma (this can kill her), this will break the tether

MW teather does not break after the initial effect, but keeps its duration and causes 10/12/14/16(based on mantra lvl up) (+.15ap) of the damage taken by the target to be redirected to karma instead (this can kill her)

This lets karma trade the damage, root, and self heal of W/MW to strengthen her allies survival and give a 1 spell redirect if used with good timing (redirecting Taric stuns can win. A trade in bot lane) basically she gives her ally a spell shield at the cost of herself taking the hit, and it requires timing to get right and has counter play due to it only being 1 spell, this would make karma a valuable support in being able to shield and spell shield, have a root, some damage, and a speed boost

Making her a cross between lulu and Morgan's support strength while having to chose offensive support or defensive support for W and at times E for the engage or disengage value

This would put her in a healthy position for 2 facts, one the damage redirect is low enough that it will be helpful but not op in early game

Two , to make it effective she has to build a lot of AP which means she could end up killing herself because she is now missing in survival stats

While as tankma this will be useful with low risk of death from it but not overly so because you lack the AP to make it strong

Basically it lets karma chose a huge helping of her ally with high self risk or a lower helping with lower self risk, or a balance between the two, and then needing CD-R for mantra CD effects how often she can do it

Just my idea of how to do it

And making her a cross between lulu and Morgan's isn't a bad thing because both are strong supports, and this change would give karma her identity back at the same time of keeping a balance in offensive and defensive decisions

Or if cast on an ally she heals them, and the ally's attacks slow the enemy during the duration, or maybe a small area root at the end if the tether isn't broken instead.

Would be nice if you could heal others with your ult tether. XD

While I like the Idea really much, I have one concern:

Why mantraing W if E has the same "goal"?

Sure there would be some difference, but Karma already has a single target life saver Ability: RE

Giving RW a similiar purpose would make it feeling less "good" because you might be confused wether you should Supershield your ally now or Bind with him/her/it.
You could make it like RW is for 2vs2 dueling and RE for Teamfights, which would leave RW in a niche spot (like it is now outside the laning phase).
Also Damaging her Boundpartner should proc her Passive, since you loose it if you cast it on an ally.
